content: The Act titled "District of Columbia Budget Autonomy Act of 2007" terminates federal mandates over the local budget process and financial management of the District of Columbia. It amends the District of Columbia Home Rule Act to include a new subpart on the termination of federal mandates. The "District of Columbia Budget Autonomy Act of 2007" eliminates federal mandates on the local budget process and financial management. Starting from fiscal year 2008, the District of Columbia will establish its budget and financial management processes under its own laws, without the application of certain provisions. This does not affect any existing financial obligations of the District. The District of Columbia Budget Autonomy Act of 2007 removes federal mandates on the local budget process and financial management, allowing the District to establish its own budget and financial management processes starting from fiscal year 2008. Section 603(b) of the Act is amended to repeal the cap on the amount of district borrowing for fiscal year 2008 and beyond. Other conforming amendments are made relating to changes in the federal role in the budget process. The District of Columbia Home Rule Act is amended to give federal authority over the budget-making process for control years. During control years, the Council and Mayor cannot approve budgets that are inconsistent with the financial plan established under the Financial Responsibility and Management Assistance Act of 1995.
